A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
*spoiler free*
Since Disney bought 'Star Wars' I have been excited about the prospect of a larger Star Wars universe.  After seeing The Force Awakens I left the cinema with a huge smile on my face.  Rogue One - the same.
After seeing The Last Jedi\, I did not have a huge smile on my face.  I couldn't work out what it was.  I didn't know if I liked it.  So I went and saw it again.  This time I knew what was coming so could get beyond the surprises and into the movie\, and now I know I do like it.
Yes\, it has its flaws - it's at least half an hour too long\, there are a couple of scenes I don't want to think about at all\, and some points that can only be called gaping plot chasms\, but overall this is a Star Wars movie - there are some good action sequences\, heroes\, villains\, mystery and fun.  It isn't what I expected\, but it's well worth a watch and I look forward to my next viewing experience.
